| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [S3RK](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28944#issuecomment-1827377177) |
| Stale ACK | [achow101](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28944#pullrequestreview-1771199234), [murchandamus](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28944#pullrequestreview-1797513405) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#28979](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28979) (wallet, rpc: document and update `sendall` behavior around unconfirmed inputs by ishaanam)
* [#28710](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28710) (Remove the legacy wallet and BDB dependency by achow101)
* [#24128](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24128) (wallet: BIP 326 sequence based anti-fee-snipe for taproot inputs by maflcko)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

ACK 5c9ac1456b7b4512845270cd850e5c33b643f575

A test for `send` would be nice as well.

> A test for send would be nice as well.

Done

In 5101f054ce435ac653a3f5e780fca066e2f25088 "test: test sendall and send do anti-fee-sniping"

nit: `gettransaction` has a `verbose` argument that does the decoding so this doesn't need to call `decoderawtransaction`. Same below.
diff_hunk:
@@ -142,7 +142,12 @@ def test_send(self, from_wallet, to_wallet=None, amount=None, data=None,
             return
 
         if locktime:
+            assert_equal(from_wallet.decoderawtransaction(from_wallet.gettransaction(res["txid"])["hex"])["locktime"], locktime)

body:
In 5101f054ce435ac653a3f5e780fca066e2f25088 "test: test sendall and send do anti-fee-sniping"

nit: `getrawtransaction` has a `verbosity` option that will do the decoding, so no need to call `decoderawtransaction` here.
diff_hunk:
@@ -379,6 +379,20 @@ def sendall_with_maxconf(self):
         assert_equal(len(self.wallet.listunspent()), 1)
         assert_equal(self.wallet.listunspent()[0]['confirmations'], 6)
 
+    @cleanup
+    def sendall_anti_fee_sniping(self):
+        self.log.info("Testing sendall does anti-fee-sniping when locktime is not specified")
+        self.add_utxos([10,11])
+        tx_from_wallet = self.test_sendall_success(sendall_args = [self.remainder_target])
+
+        assert_greater_than(tx_from_wallet["decoded"]["locktime"], tx_from_wallet["blockheight"] - 100)
+
+        self.add_utxos([10,11])
+        txid = self.wallet.sendall(recipients=[self.remainder_target], options={"locktime":0})["txid"]
+        tx_from_wallet = self.wallet.decoderawtransaction(self.wallet.getrawtransaction(txid))

body:
In 5101f054ce435ac653a3f5e780fca066e2f25088 "test: test sendall and send do anti-fee-sniping"

Shouldn't this check for `getblockcount() - 100`?
diff_hunk:
@@ -142,7 +142,12 @@ def test_send(self, from_wallet, to_wallet=None, amount=None, data=None,
             return
 
         if locktime:
+            assert_equal(from_wallet.decoderawtransaction(from_wallet.gettransaction(res["txid"])["hex"])["locktime"], locktime)
             return res
+        else:
+            if add_to_wallet:
+                decoded_tx = from_wallet.decoderawtransaction(from_wallet.gettransaction(res["txid"])["hex"])
+                assert_greater_than(decoded_tx["locktime"], 100)

@@ -142,7 +142,12 @@ def test_send(self, from_wallet, to_wallet=None, amount=None, data=None,
             return
 
         if locktime:
+            assert_equal(from_wallet.decoderawtransaction(from_wallet.gettransaction(res["txid"])["hex"])["locktime"], locktime)

@@ -379,6 +379,20 @@ def sendall_with_maxconf(self):
         assert_equal(len(self.wallet.listunspent()), 1)
         assert_equal(self.wallet.listunspent()[0]['confirmations'], 6)
 
+    @cleanup
+    def sendall_anti_fee_sniping(self):
+        self.log.info("Testing sendall does anti-fee-sniping when locktime is not specified")
+        self.add_utxos([10,11])
+        tx_from_wallet = self.test_sendall_success(sendall_args = [self.remainder_target])
+
+        assert_greater_than(tx_from_wallet["decoded"]["locktime"], tx_from_wallet["blockheight"] - 100)
+
+        self.add_utxos([10,11])
+        txid = self.wallet.sendall(recipients=[self.remainder_target], options={"locktime":0})["txid"]
+        tx_from_wallet = self.wallet.decoderawtransaction(self.wallet.getrawtransaction(txid))

@@ -142,7 +142,12 @@ def test_send(self, from_wallet, to_wallet=None, amount=None, data=None,
             return
 
         if locktime:
+            assert_equal(from_wallet.decoderawtransaction(from_wallet.gettransaction(res["txid"])["hex"])["locktime"], locktime)
             return res
+        else:
+            if add_to_wallet:
+                decoded_tx = from_wallet.decoderawtransaction(from_wallet.gettransaction(res["txid"])["hex"])
+                assert_greater_than(decoded_tx["locktime"], 100)

body: nit: blank line under this; ideally docs above

In f348eadadd6099e7763f04eb3d42cfd8bba33146 "test: test sendall and send do anti-fee-sniping"

nit: `verbose` here too.
diff_hunk:
@@ -142,7 +142,12 @@ def test_send(self, from_wallet, to_wallet=None, amount=None, data=None,
             return
 
         if locktime:
+            assert_equal(from_wallet.gettransaction(txid=res["txid"], verbose=True)["decoded"]["locktime"], locktime)
             return res
+        else:
+            if add_to_wallet:
+                decoded_tx = from_wallet.decoderawtransaction(from_wallet.gettransaction(res["txid"])["hex"])

@@ -142,7 +142,12 @@ def test_send(self, from_wallet, to_wallet=None, amount=None, data=None,
             return
 
         if locktime:
+            assert_equal(from_wallet.gettransaction(txid=res["txid"], verbose=True)["decoded"]["locktime"], locktime)
             return res
+        else:
+            if add_to_wallet:
+                decoded_tx = from_wallet.decoderawtransaction(from_wallet.gettransaction(res["txid"])["hex"])

body:
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).
I circled back to review, I think this has a merge conflict

In 8e5778a9fb6fbcbddd4ba87cc3f3caf41118592a (wallet, rpc: add anti-fee-sniping to `send` and `sendall`):

It seems to me that the `nSequence` check here is too restrictive. Locktime is disabled when _all_ sequences are set to final, but it seems to me that `can_anti_fee_snipe` would be set to `false` here, even if only one inputâs sequence is set to final.

Iâm not sure this would matter much in practice because most transactions would probably use the same sequence value for all inputs, but `can_anti_fee_snipe` should probably end up `true` if at least one `nSequence` is non-final?

Could you perhaps add a test that a transaction with final `nSequence` values does not get its `locktime` set, but one with mixed values and one with all non-final `nSequence` values both do?

> ```diff
> --- a/test/functional/wallet_import_rescan.py
> +++ b/test/functional/wallet_import_rescan.py
> @@ -293,6 +293,7 @@ class ImportRescanTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
>                  add_to_wallet=False,
>                  inputs=[unspent_txid_map[variant.initial_txid]],
>                  outputs=[{ADDRESS_BCRT1_UNSPENDABLE : variant.initial_amount}],
> +                locktime=0,
>                  subtract_fee_from_outputs=[0]
>              )
>              variant.child_txid = child["txid"]
> ```

Done
